noun.description: A man employed to empty cesspools, outdoor privies, etc., at night and to remove the waste matter. Also figurative. Now archaic and historical.
A man who works during the night or on a night shift. Also (slang): a nocturnal wrongdoer or criminal; a burglar.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in City of London Book of Fines. From night + man.
